title: A Data-Driven Exploration of Elevation Cues in HRTFs: An Explainable AI Perspective Across Multiple Datasets
author: Juan A. De Rusa (Departament d'Inform`atica, Universitat de Val`encia), Mario Montaguda (i2CAT Foundation), Jesus Lopez-Ballester (Departament d'Inform`atica, Universitat de Val`encia), Francesc J. Ferri (Departament d'Inform`atica, Universitat de Val`encia), Maximo Cobos (Departament d'Inform`atica, Universitat de Val`encia), ...
relevance_why: This paper employs convolutional neural networks (CNNs) and explainable artificial intelligence (XAI) techniques to analyze head-related transfer functions (HRTFs), which could inform your work on audio and speech processing by enhancing understanding of spatial audio classification.
background: This research analyzes how spatial audio cues affect sound localization through head-related transfer functions using data from various datasets.
contribution: This paper introduces an explainable artificial intelligence framework to analyze elevation perception cues within HRTFs, achieving deeper insights into spectral features influencing sound localization.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing studies primarily focus on individual datasets or simpler models for HRTF analysis, which limits generalizability and understanding.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work enhances interpretability by implementing convolutional neural networks and saliency techniques across eleven datasets for a broader analysis.

key_innovation: Utilizes convolutional neural networks and class activation mapping to identify spectral patterns important for elevation perception, offering interpretable insights into spatial audio cues across diverse listening conditions.
real_world_impact: This work could significantly improve the development of spatial audio applications in virtual reality, gaming, and immersive audio experiences by better understanding elevation cues.
limitations: No limitations were explicitly mentioned by the authors.

new_terms.Head-Related Transfer Function (HRTF): **Head-Related Transfer Function (HRTF)** refers to the response that characterizes how an ear receives a sound from a point in space, taking into account the effects of the head, torso, and pinnae.
new_terms.Explainable Artificial Intelligence (XAI: **Explainable Artificial Intelligence (XAI)** involves methods and techniques in AI that help make the results of the AI more understandable by humans.
new_terms.Class Activation Mapping (CAM): **Class Activation Mapping (CAM)** is a technique used to visualize the regions of an image that are most important for a model's predictions.
